title: Aiden Fisher isn‚Äôt satisfied: Indiana‚Äôs historic season means nothing without a title
description: The Hoosiers aren't content with just being in Miami.
fullText:
Aiden Fisher isn‚Äôt satisfied: Indiana‚Äôs historic season means nothing without a title originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

If you‚Äôre looking for someone inside the Indiana locker room who‚Äôs caught up in the moment, Aiden Fisher is not your guy.

The accolades, the metrics, the talk of historic runs and national relevance, Fisher hears it all. He just doesn‚Äôt care about any of it right now. Not with one game left. Not with the Miami Hurricanes standing across the field.

‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt mean really anything unless we walk away with a win in this game,‚Äù Fisher said. Simple. Flat. No drama. ‚ÄúAll that historical stuff doesn‚Äôt really mean anything to us right now.‚Äù

That mindset didn‚Äôt magically appear during a postseason run. He carried it to Bloomington when he followed Curt Cignetti from James Madison. And over time, it‚Äôs seeped into everything, even conversations with his mom.

More:¬†Indiana fans think Fernando Mendoza eats like a child because of a viral fake post

‚ÄúI caught myself using the word ‚Äòcomplacent,‚Äô‚Äù Fisher said, laughing. ‚ÄúI was like, wow, I‚Äôve been with Cig way too long. Everything he talks about is true in football and in life. Complacency kills.‚Äù

Even with a national championship on deck, Fisher insists the approach doesn‚Äôt change. Same field. Same pads. Same four quarters. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just football,‚Äù he said.

More:¬†Fernando Mendoza sends clear message on Indiana's first national championship berth

Still, he knows what this is. He‚Äôs made sure younger players understand it too. Opportunities like this don‚Äôt come back around. One week. Total focus. No shortcuts.

‚ÄúPrepare like it‚Äôs your last game,‚Äù Fisher said. ‚ÄúSo you can walk off with no regrets.‚Äù

Indiana has already changed how it‚Äôs viewed nationally.

Fisher isn‚Äôt interested in how the story sounds unless it ends the right way.

title: Lewis Hamilton to get new Ferrari F1 race engineer in 2026
description: Former race engineer Riccardo Adami will move into a new role with Ferrari's young driver squad
fullText:
Riccardo Adami will no longer serve as Lewis Hamilton's race engineer at Ferrari as the Italian has taken up a new role within the Formula 1 team's young driver programme.

Adami, who was previously the race engineer for both Sebastian Vettel and Carlos Sainz at the team, will now oversee the testing of previous cars running for the Ferrari Driver Academy and thus relinquishes his trackside role.

Hamilton was paired with Adami for his first season at the Prancing Horse, although the partnership was put under scrutiny when apparent early communication issues were publicly broadcast on F1's world feed.

While the two achieved early success with Hamilton's sprint race victory in China, the seven-time champion's season petered out with a series of Q1 eliminations.

It had been suggested that the relationship between Hamilton and Adami had lacked the requisite chemistry owing to the occasional terseness over the radio, although this was denied by both driver and team.

A communique provided by the team stated that: "Scuderia Ferrari HP announces that Riccardo Adami has moved to a new role within the Scuderia Ferrari Driver Academy as Scuderia Ferrari Driver Academy and Test Previous Cars Manager, where his extensive trackside experience and Formula 1 expertise contributes to the development of future talent and to strengthening performance culture across the program.

"Scuderia Ferrari HP would like to thank Riccardo for his commitment and contribution to his trackside role and wishes him every success in his new position.

"The appointment of the new Race Engineer for car #44 will be announced in due course."

Adami had been Vettel's race engineer at the Toro Rosso team, and had also fulfilled a similar role for the likes of Daniel Ricciardo, Sebastien Buemi, and Vitantonio Liuzzi within the Faenza squad. He then reunited with Vettel upon leaving Toro Rosso in 2015.

Sebastian Vettel reveals advice he gave Lewis Hamilton for Ferrari F1 move

Ferrari insists relationship with Lewis Hamilton isn't as bad as it seems

After 2025's Australian Grand Prix, Hamilton responded to the assertions that radio traffic between the pair suggested that the two had not meshed, suggesting that people should "go and listen to the radio calls with others and their engineers, they're far worse".

Ferrari's head of track engineering Matteo Togninalli added during the Qatar weekend that "what you see from outside is worse" than the reality of their collaboration.

Regardless, Hamilton will have to form a new working relationship with another engineer; it is unknown whether Ferrari will seek to promote from within, or hire externally.

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Badgers land speedy pass-rusher in portal who had 15 sacks in 2025
description: The Badgers got another addition to their pass rush on Thursday.
fullText:
The Wisconsin Badgers got another addition in the transfer portal on Thursday night, as Hope College pass rusher Liam Danitz committed to the program while on an official visit to Madison.

Danitz, a 6‚Äô5, 230-pound edge rusher who hails from Michigan, had a monster year for D-III Hope College this year, recording 15 sacks and 21 tackles for loss. In the two prior seasons, Danitz had recorded 12 sacks and 18.5 tackles for loss. While he is currently out of eligibility, Danitz is expected to apply for a waiver, as one of his four seasons went towards track-and-field.

This is a bold move from the Badgers, as they‚Äôre taking a chance on a D-III pass rusher with tantalizing traits. Danitz has elite speed, running a 10.55 100-meter dash and 20.92 200-meter dash in college. Now, it‚Äôs on Wisconsin‚Äôs staff to get the most out of that and find a way to get him on the field.

Danitz had been receiving some serious Power 4 interest after his track numbers were released, but he visited Wisconsin first and committed to the Badgers then and there.

Wisconsin has added a few different edge rushers this offseason. They added jumbo edge Justus Boone, an Arkansas transfer, who lines up at 6‚Äô5, 290 pounds and can play on the inside. They also got Tennessee freshman transfer Jayden Loftin, for whom the Badgers were a serious suitor last year in his high school recruitment.

Now, they‚Äôre adding a third with Danitz, getting some experience in a relatively young room.

title: Vergil Ortiz Jr. sues Golden Boy for breach of contract, asks to have promotional deal voided
description: Golden Boy finds itself in a legal battle with yet another of its top stars.
fullText:
Golden Boy finds itself in a legal battle with yet another of its top stars.

Oscar De La Hoya's promotional company, which has been sued in recent years by Saul "Canelo" Alvarez and Ryan Garcia, now finds itself on the end of a legal challenge by WBC interim champion Vergil Ortiz Jr.

A lawsuit was filed on behalf of Ortiz in a Nevada court on Thursday, asking for Declaratory relief and claiming breach of contract and interference with prospective economic advantage.

Ortiz signed a three-year promotional contract with Golden Boy in May 2024, earning a minimum guarantee of $1 million per fight. Lawyers for Ortiz claim that, under the agreement, Ortiz can terminate his contract with Golden Boy if the promoter no longer has an active broadcast deal with DAZN and has not secured an exclusive distribution agreement with an alternative broadcaster.

Golden Boy's contract with DAZN ended on Dec. 31, 2025, and has not been renewed yet, although the pair are in talks for a possible extension. Lawyers for Golden Boy argue that Ortiz is not yet a free agent because they are still in negotiations with DAZN for a new media rights agreement.

At the center of this dispute is one of boxing's most anticipated fights.

Ortiz and Jaron "Boots" Ennis faced off in the ring after the former's win over Erickson Lubin on Nov. 8.

Negotiations have continued in the months since but a bout between the pair has yet to materialize. In recent weeks, it became apparent that the conflict between Ortiz's promoter, De La Hoya, and his manager, Rick Mirigian, was not helping matters along.

Mirigian has claimed he has the right to negotiate on Ortiz's behalf directly with promoter Eddie Hearn of Matchroom Boxing because of the belief from Ortiz's side's that they are a promotional free agent. De La Hoya has made multiple videos and posts on his Instagram page asserting that he has the exclusive promotional rights for Ortiz Jr.'s fights, hence the legal battle that appears set to ensue.

According to Hearn, he and De La Hoya agreed on a 45%/45% purse split ‚Äî with the remaining 10% going to the winner ‚Äî to match the pair during a meeting with the Golden Boy chief and DAZN executives in 2025, but De La Hoya has since asked for a 55%-35% deal, with 10% to the winner. De La Hoya's feuds with Hearn, Turki Alalshikh and other promoters have prevented De La Hoya from working on behalf of Ortiz to maximize his revenue opportunities, it is claimed in the suit.

DAZN has not renewed Golden Boy's contract yet, in part because of the company's failure to make a fight with Ennis next, Uncrowned has learned. A highly-placed DAZN source told Uncrowned that a contest between Ortiz and Ennis is the only one that it wants to see next for the boxers, and it is putting significant pressure on De La Hoya and Hearn to make the match.

Golden Boy has informed Ortiz that it is the only fight it wants to make for the boxer, which is allegedly a violation of his contract that requires a minimum of three potential opponents.

Timing is key. While De La Hoya's contract with DAZN has recently expired, Hearn's media rights deal with DAZN has just six months left and is also in talks for a renewal. With Top Rank and Premier Boxing Champions recently losing their network deals and finding themselves unable to secure adequate replacements, it is apparent that De La Hoya and Hearn will not want to find themselves searching for a new boxing broadcaster.

title: Ferrari vs Mercedes: What the 2026 F1 season holds after latest insights
description: Ferrari and Mercedes are preparing for a transformative 2026 Formula 1 season, with both teams entering the new era of regulations under intense scrutiny and high expectations. The major power unit and aerodynamic changes introduced by the FIA will demand a full redesign of their cars, setting the stage for one of the most anticipated seasons in recent memory.
fullText:
Ferrari and Mercedes are preparing for a transformative 2026 Formula 1 season, with both teams entering the new era of regulations under intense scrutiny and high expectations.

The major power unit and aerodynamic changes introduced by the FIA will demand a full redesign of their cars, setting the stage for one of the most anticipated seasons in recent memory.

Ferrari has officially confirmed that its 2026 Formula 1 car will be called the SF26. It will be driven by Charles Leclerc and Lewis Hamilton, marking Hamilton‚Äôs second season with the team.

The Maranello-based outfit is scheduled to unveil the SF26 on January 23, 2026, just ahead of pre-season testing in Barcelona.

According to Ferrari team principal Frederic Vasseur, the new car represents a ‚Äúfresh start‚Äù for the Scuderia, fully adapted to the sweeping 2026 regulation changes that will reshape the sport‚Äôs hybrid power units and aerodynamic principles.

Ferrari‚Äôs focus has been on ensuring its power unit meets the new FIA guidelines, which emphasize sustainability, electrical efficiency, and reduced drag.

While specific design features remain confidential, team sources have suggested the car is being developed with an emphasis on energy recovery performance and mechanical balance.

Mercedes has confirmed that its 2026 contender will be called the W17 E Performance, continuing the team‚Äôs naming convention. The car will be unveiled on January 22, 2026, one day before Ferrari‚Äôs launch.

Team principal Toto Wolff has described the upcoming season as ‚Äúa fresh opportunity to innovate and redefine performance under a completely new rulebook.‚Äù

The Brackley outfit has emphasized reliability and adaptability as key priorities for the W17. Mercedes engineers have spent much of the past year developing their next-generation hybrid power unit to align with the new 50/50 internal combustion-to-electric power balance mandated by the FIA.

The team has also conducted early performance simulations, focusing on optimizing energy efficiency and aerodynamic flexibility.

Both Ferrari and Mercedes will enter the 2026 season with renewed optimism and extensive technical overhauls.

Ferrari‚Äôs new direction under Vasseur and Hamilton‚Äôs leadership gives the team fresh momentum, while Mercedes‚Äô deep experience with hybrid systems may offer an early edge as the new regulations take effect.

As both cars prepare to hit the track for the first time in Barcelona, the competition between Ferrari and Mercedes could define the early stages of Formula 1‚Äôs new era.

title: How transfer portal player Sean Thompkins fits with LSU football, OL depth chart
description: Baylor sophomore transfer offensive line Sean Thompkins has commits to LSU football. Here's how he fits in Lane Kiffin's offense.
fullText:
BATON ROUGE ‚Äì Lane Kiffin's rebuild of LSU football's offense is starting to take shape.

The last biggest piece of the puzzle for him and his offensive is filling out the bodies and depth along the offensive line. LSU got another quality player to add to the mix as Baylor sophomore transfer offensive lineman Sean Thompkins commits to LSU football, per his agents.

Thompkins was initially committed to North Carolina out of the transfer portal but LSU got him to flip.

LSU FOOTBALL PORTAL COVERAGE LSU football transfer portal tracker: Baylor transfer OL commits to LSU

Last season, the 6-5, 300-pounder started five games for the Bears. He has two years of eligibility remaining.

Thompkins was just on campus Thursday for a visit and it's apparent that what the LSU program has to offer him along with the prospect of playing in Kiffin's offense was enough to persuade him to decommit from North Carolina and join the Tigers.

Plenty of schools were after him in the portal and LSU wins the sweepstakes.

Thompkins brings experience to the tackle group and he will be vying for a starting role.

Missouri edge rusher Damon Wilson

Ohio State safety Faheem Delane

Ole Miss linebacker T.J. Dottery

Maryland offensive lineman Aliou Bah

North Dakota linebacker Theo Grace

Minnesota offensive lineman Kahlee Tafai

Ole Miss offensive lineman Devin Harper

Wake Forest wide receiver Sterling Berkhalter

Alabama offensive lineman Micah DeBose

North Carolina State wide receiver Terrell Anderson

Arkansas wide receiver Andy Jean

California-Davis running back Carter Vargas

McNeese State cornerback Javon Davis

The NCAA transfer portal window closes Jan. 16. Players cannot enter their name in the portal following that date, but those whose name is already in the transfer portal can still decide and sign with a new school after Jan. 16.

Cory Diaz covers the LSU Tigers for The Daily Advertiser as part of the USA TODAY¬†Network. Follow his Tigers coverage on Twitter: @ByCoryDiaz. Got questions regarding¬†LSU athletics? Send them to Cory Diaz at¬†bdiaz@gannett.com.

title: Hojlund snubbed Milan before moving from Man Utd to Napoli: the background
description: Rasmus Hojlund could have ended up at Milan before his move away from Manchester United, but the striker ultimately rejected the Rossoneri in favour of Napoli due to sporting and contractual guarantee...
fullText:
Rasmus Hojlund could have ended up at Milan before his move away from Manchester United, but the striker ultimately rejected the Rossoneri in favour of Napoli due to sporting and contractual guarantees.

According to journalist Matteo Moretto, via MilanNews, Milan had put a serious proposal on the table for the Denmark international during talks with Manchester United.

The Rossoneri offered a paid loan worth ‚Ç¨3.5m, with an option to buy set at ‚Ç¨35m, a sizeable operation that underlined their interest in reshaping the attack around the Dane.

Despite the financial commitment, negotiations never truly gathered momentum. The decisive factor was not United‚Äôs stance, but Hojlund‚Äôs own assessment of the move.

NAPLES, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 07: Rasmus Hojlund of SSC Napoli shows his disappointment during the Serie A match between SSC Napoli and Hellas Verona FC at Stadio Diego Armando Maradona on January 07, 2026 in Naples, Italy. (Photo by Francesco Pecoraro/Getty Images)

The striker carefully evaluated the sporting context and ultimately decided that Milan‚Äôs proposal did not fully meet his requirements.

First, Hojlund was determined to continue playing in the Champions League, a competition he views as essential for his development and international profile.

Secondly, he wanted clear guarantees over a permanent transfer rather than a deal dependent on conditions or future negotiations.

Napoli were able to offer exactly that.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 11: Rasmus Hojlund of SSC Napoli shoots during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and SSC Napoli at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 11, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

The Partenopei moved with greater conviction, presenting Hojlund with a defined technical project and firm assurances over the buy clause, which proved decisive.

Milan are left with some regret over an ambitious move that fell apart due to the player‚Äôs demands rather than a lack of intent from the club.

title: (Video): How Thiago Silva used to get Trevoh Chalobah in trouble at school
description: Trevoh Chalobah has a big Match of the Day interview coming up this weekend, and the BBC have been teasing little bits of it in advance.Trevoh Chalobah names his top 3 defendersThey asked Trevoh to na...
fullText:
Trevoh Chalobah has a big Match of the Day interview coming up this weekend, and the BBC have been teasing little bits of it in advance.

They asked Trevoh to name his top 3 centre backs and why he liked them so much. His answers tell you a lot about the kind of players he wants to be.

‚ÄúNumber three, Thiago Silva. I used to watch him back in school on Youtube and get in trouble. For me he just has everything. He can head, he can play, when he was in his prime he was quick, he was strong, a leader. I‚Äôve always loved Thiago.‚Äù

‚ÄúNumber two I‚Äôd go for Sergio Ramos, just a winner. A leader. Always wants to put his body on the line. I used to watch a lot of El Clasico and he would stand out,‚Äù the defender continued.

‚ÄúNumber one? John Terry, legend of the club. What he did in the Premier League, what he did for the club. He helped me out a lot when I was younger and I would train with the first team. He would be the one to put his arm around the young players, to help them gain a bit of confidence, you know.‚Äù

A very good set of answers there. It never ceases to amaze us how many nice things you‚Äôll find everyone saying about JT who has worked at Chelsea.

You can see Chalobah speaking in the clip embedded here:

While Chelsea delay, their sister club is getting into gear. Strasbourg have already agreed a ‚Ç¨7m deal for a talented attacking midfielder who will apparently take his medical today.

Chelsea are suddenly seemingly interested in January transfer moves, and Matt Law of the Daily Telegraph has a big update on a potential sale the Blues could made.

title: Stephen Curry appears interested in joining the Hornets
description: This would be a feel-good story for the Curry family.
fullText:
Stephen Curry appears interested in joining the Hornets originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Charlotte Hornets have turned heads around the league recently. They began to gain recognition after defeating the defending champion Oklahoma City Thunder on the road by 27 points.

Later they defeated the Utah Jazz away from home by 55 points, the largest margin of victory this season.

Thursday night they impressed once again, earning another road win, defeating the Los Angeles Lakers 135-117.

Now, they face a challenging matchup ahead of them Saturday, squaring off against Stephen Curry and the Warriors.

The game comes just days after the Hornets announced that they would retire Dell Curry's jersey, 10-year Hornets player and father of Stephen.

However, there could be a chance that Dell's No. 30 gets temporarily unretired.

Speaking with the media, Dell revealed that Stephen asked him if he could wear the number if he became a member of the Hornets. Dell replied: "No doubt."

When social media caught wind of this, speculation ensued. Although Stephen has spent his entire 17-year career with Golden State, it says a lot that he's seemingly still considering returning to his hometown to join the Hornets.

After this season, Curry has one more year on his current deal with the Warriors and will then become a free agent ahead of the 2027-28 season. By then, Curry will be entering his age 39 season.

If Curry were to wear No. 30 for Charlotte, it will have been a jersey number shared by the entire family, as his brother Seth Curry wore it during his 76 games as a Hornet.

title: Tyler Warren invited to 2026 Pro Bowl Games
description: Indianapolis Colts rookie tight end Tyler Warren capped off his sensational debut season with an invitation to the 2026 Pro Bowl Games in San Francisco.
fullText:
Indianapolis Colts rookie tight end Tyler Warren capped off his sensational debut season with an invitation to the 2026 Pro Bowl Games in San Francisco.

For a Colts offense that was in desperate need of a pass catcher who could provide consistent stability and allow the offense to sustain more drives, Warren blossomed into a franchise cornerstone.

Selected with the No. 14 overall pick in the 2025 NFL Draft, Warren started all 17 games for Indianapolis and set franchise rookie records with 76 catches for 817 receiving yards. Warren also scored five total touchdowns in his rookie campaign. His 817 receiving yards ranked fifth among all NFL tight ends, while his 487 yards after catch ranked second among all tight ends, behind only Cardinals‚Äô Trey McBride.

Tyler Warren 10 Games, 50 REC, 617 YDS, 4 Total TDs. 

2025 Mid Season Highlights. https://t.co/kX32daI8N4 pic.twitter.com/h45UaCMs2m

‚Äî Football Performances (@NFLPerformances) November 13, 2025

The Pro Bowl nod places Warren in rare company, becoming just the 18th rookie tight end in NFL history to earn a Pro Bowl selection and the first Colt to do so in the Indianapolis-era of the franchise. Warren joins a pair of teammates, including running back Jonathan Taylor and left guard Quenton Nelson as Indy‚Äôs third player invited to the Pro Bowl. Warren will replace Raiders‚Äô Brock Bowers, who is unable to compete due to an injury.

Warren‚Äôs rapid ascent shows just how valuable he was within an offense built around its established stars, and a Pro Bowl stage is now waiting to move into its next chapter.

cheers to the pro bowler. pic.twitter.com/HWa7tmuSzY

‚Äî Indianapolis Colts (@Colts) January 16, 2026

title: Casey joins Orient after Swans exit
description: West Ham United youngster Kaelan Casey has joined League One side Leyton Orient on loan just 24 hours after his spell at Swansea City was ended.  The Hammers cut short Casey's season-long stint in Wales because they wanted the 21-year-old centre-back to play more regular football.  Casey has now dropped from the Championship to the third tier in the hope that he will get more game-time at Orient.
fullText:
West Ham United youngster Kaelan Casey has joined League One side Leyton Orient on loan just 24 hours after his spell at Swansea City was ended.

The Hammers cut short Casey's season-long stint in Wales because they wanted the 21-year-old centre-back to play more regular football.

Casey has now dropped from the Championship to the third tier in the hope that he will get more game-time at Orient.

The West Ham academy product made 13 appearances for Swansea, though only three of those were Championship starts.

"My time at Swansea City was a great learning experience but I want to play regular football," Casey told the Orient website.

"I believe that Orient is the best place for me to get that whilst also helping the club to move forwards.

"I spoke to [Swansea's former Orient players] Lawrence Vigouroux and Ethan Galbraith, and they both only had good things to say about the set-up, the staff and the fans. That's another reason I wanted to join and I can't wait to get going."

title: As John Harbaugh euphoria fades, new Giants coach will face some tough questions | Politi
description: Harbaugh Mania is understandable. But here's a reality check.
fullText:
John Harbaugh is exactly the leader the Giants needed to hire at this point in their long history to bring a level of credibility and competence that this franchise has been lacking for more than a decade. Harbaugh Mania, however, is just a wee bit over the top.

These two things can be true at the same time.

Giants fans who have sat through a string of 10-loss seasons with a collection of overmatched head coaches on the sideline have every right to celebrate the news that the former Super Bowl champion picked their team over a host of suitors.

But if they‚Äôre picking their spot on the sidewalk in the Canyon of Heroes, ready for the confetti to start falling, they probably need a reality check.

Oh, they might not want one, which is perfectly understandable. If you‚Äôre a Giants fan who wants this honeymoon to last straight into next season without even considering that Harbaugh might not be Vince Lombardi reincarnated, just stop reading here. We‚Äôll see you in September, that wide smile still plastered on your face, at MetLife Stadium.

If you‚Äôre ready for a little cold water to be thrown on this party ‚Äî not a bucket full, just a thimble! ‚Äî then, please, read on.

Harbaugh can expect his introductory press conference to feel more like a coronation than an inquisition given the current state of the Giants ‚Äî maybe not a Jacksonville-level love fest, but still, a happy occasion nonetheless.

But there are some tough questions that Harbaugh needs to answer about how his time in Baltimore ended and how that relates to his plans for his new team. They are questions that, hopefully, Giants officials asked him while they wined-and-dined him at aa Route 17 Greek restaurant.

What happened at the end with Lamar Jackson? Did your relationship with the Ravens star quarterback sour in your final season together? With Jackson starting, the Ravens had a 3-6 playoff record and just reaching one AFC title game appearance. Is there any regret that you didn‚Äôt reach a single Super Bowl with a two-time MVP who was in the prime of his career?

No head coach has won a Super Bowl with two different franchises. Your victory in the big game happened in 2013, a lifetime ago in professional football. What makes you confident that your second act can be as good as your first?

At 63, you likely will start 2025 as the second-oldest coach in professional football. Age is just a number, of course, and one could argue that the best coaches (Andy Reid, Sean Payton) are your contemporaries. But coaching is quickly becoming a young man‚Äôs profession. How will you continue to adapt to the changes in the sport?

The Giants, under general manager Joe Schoen, have a long list of failures in the draft and free agency. You wouldn‚Äôt be here if you didn‚Äôt believe in him, to some extent. What gives you confidence that he can build a championship roster? And, if you believe that the talent isn‚Äôt there in Year 1, are you ready to exert your considerable influence to force a change?

In the event of a disagreement on roster decisions, do you have assurances that you‚Äôll ultimately be the one with final say over the general manager? Is that written into your contract?

Since 2021, the Ravens have lost 12 games while leading by seven or more points in the fourth quarter, the most in NFL history in a five-year span. You are taking over a team that suffered its own collection of late-game losses this season. Why was this an issue in Baltimore, and why will it be different here?

Jaxson Dart proved to be a dangerous runner in rookie season. He also missed time because of concussions and, despite numerous hard hits to the head, has taken an almost dismissive attitude about protecting himself. How do you harness that part of his game while protecting him against injuries that could shorten his career?

Todd Monken, who is expected to follow you to New Jersey as offensive coordinator, recently said that he ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt coach Lamar (Jackson) well enough‚Äù as the NFL‚Äôs top offense regressed in 2025. Given the Giants‚Äô long-term success rides on developing Dart, are there any concerns about Monken‚Äôs ability to handle this important role?

Few coaches have ever arrived in the New York market with more hype than you. The Giants needed to win two meaningless games at the end of last season just to finish 4-13. How will you manage expectations if the team‚Äôs performance can‚Äôt match the current level of excitement in the fan base?

Again: It is okay to be excited about John Harbaugh become the Giants coach. In some ways, this might be the franchise‚Äôs biggest January victory since the days that Tom Coughlin and Eli Manning where leading it to those third and fourth Lombardi Trophies.

But the new guy arrives with some fair questions ‚Äî about the past and the future ‚Äî that he‚Äôll face in the coming weeks and months. If he really is going to live up to Harbaugh Mania, he‚Äôll have all the right answers.

title: Ford's Nani Roma survives late crash and fuel drama to keep Dakar podium hopes alive
description: Roma needed a "miracle" to complete the penultimate stage of Dakar 2026 after running into a series of issues late in the day
fullText:
Nani Roma described Stage 12 of the 2026 Dakar Rally as ‚Äúthe toughest day of my career‚Äù after a late crash, mechanical damage and a fuel shortage nearly ended his podium hopes.

With the finish line in sight, the factory Ford driver lost one of the wheels on his Raptor, completing the timed part of the stage on three wheels.

However, his troubles were not over, as he still needed to complete the transport section of nearly 200km to reach the bivouac in Yanbu.

While his hopes of a third career victory in Dakar were all but over by this phase of the rally, consolidating his second place finish was still vital, especially with other Ford drivers even further behind in the standings.

‚ÄúI lost a bit of concentration," he told the media including Motorsport.com. "There was wind, dust‚Ä¶ and when I looked back at the track, the impact was huge. I locked everything up.‚Äù

ü§úü§õ Ford mates backing Nani Roma after his right suspension broke just before the ASS. #Dakar2026 pic.twitter.com/zava25BC7B

‚Äî DAKAR RALLY (@dakar) January 16, 2026

The car was severely damaged, and several Ford drivers, including Romain Dumas, Mitch Guthrie and Martin Prokop had to step in to help the Spaniard.

Le Mans 24 Hours and Pikes Peak winner Dumas offered his Raptor's front axle in order to help Roma repair his car and reach the finish line.

‚ÄúToday is, surely, the hardest day of my career. I don‚Äôt believe in miracles‚Ä¶ but today I do,‚Äù he told the media. ‚ÄúWithout the team I wouldn‚Äôt be here. It‚Äôs impossible."

However, there was more drama for Roma, with his Ford running out of fuel just seven kilometres from the bivouac.

This is when Ebro driver Laia Sanz came into the picture. Roma had overtaken her on the route and asked for help. In a striking act of sportsmanship, the Catalan driver towed his Ford to the finish line - a gesture that saved a podium place.

‚ÄúYesterday I was saying there are no miracles‚Ä¶ this is one," he added.

With just the final stage and more than 100km of timed running remaining, Roma is more than 15 minutes behind Al-Attiyah, who is on course for a sixth career win in Dakar.

Winning the prestigious Touareg trophy is now almost a pipe dream for Roma, holding second place after what he endured feels like a moral victory.

‚ÄúThere comes a moment when you no longer think about the podium. You think about crying,‚Äù he said.

Dakar 2026, Stage 12: Nasser Al-Attiyah wins to extend overall lead

title: Key former Las Vegas Raiders in NFL Divisional Playoff round
description: There are some familiar names playing in the NFL playoffs this weekend
fullText:
Last week, Las Vegas Raiders general manager Jon Spytek noted that there were plenty of former players still playing. Now , as the playoffs move onto the divisional round, let‚Äôs look at the former Raiders still playing, presented in alphabetical order:

Defensive tackle Andrew Billings.

Billings is a Bears‚Äô backup who started 14 games for the Raiders in 2022. He signed with Chicago as a free agent in 2023.

The backup played for the Raiders in 2o22 and signed with the Broncos in 2023.

Defensive end Denico Autry, Tackle Trent Brown, tight end Harrison Bryant.

Autry is a backup. He played for the Raiders from 2014-17 after being undrafted. Brown started seven games this season. He was a high-dollar free-agent signing for the Raiders in 2019. His tenure there didn‚Äôt go well. Bryant is a deep backup. He spent 2024 with the Raiders as a free agent. He signed with the Eagles in March and then was traded to Houston.

Wide receiver Davante Adams, quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo.

Adams is a major part of the Rams‚Äô offense and is playing well in his first season there. Adams had an infamous entire for the Raiders from 2022-24 when the team traded for him and then shipped him out less than three years late. In the end, his time in Las Vegas isn‚Äôt looked upon fondly by many. Garoppolo spent one rocky season with the Raiders, in 2023.

Tight end Austin Hooper, tackle Thayer Munford, linebackers K‚ÄôLavon Chaisson and Robert Spillane.

Hooper is a backup. He was a backup for the Raiders in 2023. Munford was a seventh0rround pick by the Raiders and he played there from 2022-24. He signed with the Patriots this season, reuniting with former Raiders‚Äô head coach Josh McDaniels, who is the Patriots‚Äô offensive coordinator this year after being released. Chaisson played 15 games with the Raiders last season and he signed with New England this offseason. He has been a key contributor. Spillane, who the Raiders‚Äô signed in free agency in 2023, signed in free agency with the Patriots in 2025. He is a big part of the New England defense. He is under contract for two more seasons.

He was the No. 4 overall draft pick by the Raiders in 2019. He had an underwhelming tenure there from 2019-2o22. He is a deep backup for the 49ers.

He never made the Raiders‚Äô roster as an undrafted free agent in 2023. After a strong preseason, the Seahawks claimed him off waivers and he has become a lynchpin of the the Seattle defense this season.

title: The Incredible Choking Packers
description: There is a lot of luck in football but‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know man.
fullText:
I agree with many of my APC brethren that there is not a clear upgrade from Matt LaFleur out there at the moment, and that bringing him back is probably, objectively, the correct thing to do.

However, I‚Äôm also getting pretty sick of the Green Bay Packers playing like losers. LaFleur is a great play designer, which is why the Packers often build big leads, but as Mike Tyson once said, ‚ÄúEveryone has a plan until they get punched in the face.‚Äù When the Packers inevitably get punched in the face, all they do is turtle.

The nflfastR model‚Äôs Win Percentage metrics are, like their Expected Points Added (EPA) cousin, based on quantifying how often a team goes on to win in a given situation based on what has actually happened over the last three to four seasons. It‚Äôs not perfect, of course, as an elite team with an explosive offense, like the Drake Maye Pats, for instance, is more likely to wage an improbable comeback than the Titans. But it‚Äôs still generally useful in providing context on where you stand in a given game.

And so my point here isn‚Äôt that in all of these Packer games, they had a 90 percent-plus chance of winning. It‚Äôs not that exact. However, I don‚Äôt think we really need to be THAT exact with our percentages when discussing this problem! My point is that they were VERY likely to win all of these.

And they didn‚Äôt win any of them. And that‚Äôs weird. Yes, football is filled with randomness, and of course, once the Packers lost Micah Parsons, they became less capable of closing out games on the defensive side, reasonably so.

And remember, only three of these came after the Parsons injury.

And it‚Äôs not necessarily even a problem limited to this year. It was more pronounced this year, to be sure, but‚Ä¶

They‚Äôve had some real collapses. And maybe that last one doesn‚Äôt seem quite as bad as the 49ers were ALSO above 75% to win it for much of the game, but the Packers rallied, and had the lead and the ball with six minutes to go in field goal range. Just six minutes from victory! And of course, it was conservative play calling and a missed Anders Carlson field goal that got them, because of course it was.

It‚Äôs one thing to just run into a superior opponent and lose the game, but teams are NOT supposed to lose quite so many games that they were winning when they were at least evenly matched enough that they should have pulled it off. And it wasn‚Äôt the first time it happened against the 49ers in the playoffs.

I know that every team has its failures. Only one team wins the Super Bowl every year, and everyone else will always see some level of disappointment. But this year was filled with a lot of rug pulls, and the Packers rarely end their season getting blown out. They‚Äôve made a habit of having a game in the palm of their hand and just giving it away. At some point, this isn‚Äôt just statistical noise anymore.

title: Ole Miss transfer offensive lineman Devin Harper commits to LSU
description: Ole Miss transfer offensive lineman Devin Harper is committing to LSU via the NCAA transfer portal, On3 has learned. Harper spent just one season in Oxford after being a highly sought-after recruit. Once upon a time, Harper was committed to the in-state Tigers. Brian Kelly was still the head coach at the time, opting to [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Ole Miss transfer offensive lineman Devin Harper is committing to LSU via the NCAA transfer portal, On3 has learned. Harper spent just one season in Oxford after being a highly sought-after recruit.

Once upon a time, Harper was committed to the in-state Tigers. Brian Kelly was still the head coach at the time, opting to play in Lane Kiffin‚Äòs program instead. Of course, coaching changes have since taken place, and Kiffin now resides in Baton Rouge. Hence, the decision to transfer.

Harper played in a handful of games as a true freshman, mostly as a reserve. Results were considered positive, getting a glowing review from the coaching staff during fall camp.

‚ÄúDevin has relentless effort,‚Äù former Ole Miss offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. said via On3 | Rivals‚Äô The Ole Miss Spirit. ‚ÄúFor a true freshman, he plays extremely hard. He‚Äôs extremely talented. Very athletic. So, those are the things that, number one, stand out.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got to continue to work on the playbook, his strength, all the other traits that come with time. But this is probably the most talented true freshman lineman, I think, we‚Äôve seen here since I‚Äôve been here with a guy that‚Äôs got a very elite skillset and the right mindset, tenacity, that you want for that position to play early.‚Äù

Ole Miss did plan on having him return for the 2026 season, announcing as such just six days ago. But a change of direction appears to have taken place. Three years of eligibility are expected to remain for Harper at LSU.

Harper played high school football at Shreveport (LA) Calvary Baptist Academy, where he was a four-star prospect. He was the No. 84 overall recruit in the 2025 cycle, according to the Rivals Industry Ranking, a weighted average that utilizes all four major recruiting media companies.

Rivals saw a comparison between Harper and former Buffalo Bills offensive lineman Dion Dawkins. ‚ÄúLength and physicality‚Äù were the main traits to two share. Dawkins was a second-round pick back in the 2017 NFL Draft, currently on a run of five consecutive Pro Bowls while protecting quarterback Josh Allen.

The 2025-26 college football transfer portal will last 15 days, spanning from Jan. 2 to Jan. 16, the NCAA decided. While players have just over two weeks¬† to enter the portal, they‚Äôre not under a deadline to commit when they enter. Traditionally, the cut-off for committing has been how late a school can enroll a player through admissions, so it varies throughout the sport.

To keep up with the latest players on the move, check out¬†On3‚Äôs Transfer Portal wire. The On3 Transfer Portal¬†Instagram account¬†and¬†Twitter account¬†are excellent resources to stay up to date with the latest moves.

fullText:

title: NFL Divisional Round Predictions & Picks ‚Äì Underdog Best Bets Against the Spread
description: Jason Logan breaks down his favorite underdog bets of the NFL Divisional Round, including the Denver Broncos.
fullText:
The start of the NFL playoffs saw underdogs bark loudly, with point spread pups finishing 4-2 ATS.

What does that mean for this weekend?

Overall, Divisional Round dogs are 21-18-1 ATS going back to the 2015-16 season, but that‚Äôs after underdog NFL picks put forth a 4-0 ATS windfall last January.

The second round of the tournament has traditionally been tougher sledding for teams getting the points ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre getting a single tally or more than a touchdown.

Here are my NFL Underdogs picks and predictions for the Divisional Round.

Last week: 1-1 ATS
Season: 32-22-2 ATS (+6.56 units)

Best bet: Denver Broncos +1.5
(-120 at FanDuel)

This was one of my first bets of the Divisional Round. Who wouldn‚Äôt like a rested No. 1 seed hosting a badly bruised opponent on a short week?

There are tables in the parking lot of Highmark Stadium in better shape than the Buffalo Bills, as they head up the mountain to face the Denver Broncos on Saturday. Buffalo is down to four healthy WRs, the defense just lost its veteran safety, and QB Josh Allen took a ‚ÄúHell in a Cell‚Äù like beating in the win at Jacksonville.

Denver is an elite defense with two weeks to scheme for Allen & Co. The Broncos‚Äô rushing defense has been iffy toward the end of the year, but given the missing pieces in the Bills' passing game, Vance Joseph can sell out on stopping RB James Cook and force Allen to throw into the teeth of this stop unit.

Buffalo was able to overcome the run being nullified by the Jaguars in the Wild Card Round, with Allen methodically picking apart the Jacksonville zone coverage. However, the Denver secondary is stingier, and its man-centric schemes match up well against a depleted Bills receiving corps.

Allen, overall, has struggled against man coverage. He‚Äôs tops in the NFL in many metrics versus zone, but sees his output tempered in terms of completion percentage, passer rating, and catchable ball rate against zone schemes.

Best bet: Chicago Bears +4
(-114 at BetRivers)

This spread has slimmed from Los Angeles Rams -4.5 as low as -3.5, with Matthew Stafford‚Äôs injured throwing hand fueling that initial adjustment. But you can still find the Chicago Bears +4 on the board, which is a spread that holds more value than you think.

Four has become an under-the-radar key number in NFL betting in recent years, especially since the league moved the PAT further back. From a handicapping standpoint, the 4-point spread has become a ‚ÄúBermuda Triangle‚Äù of betting: favorites win but don‚Äôt cover.

Going back to 2015, when the PAT was moved from the two to the 15-yard line, 4-point favorites win outright 58% of the time but cover in just 45% of those games. In the 29 seasons prior, 4-point chalk won 69% of their games and covered the spread at a 56% rate.

Since 2020, that ATS clip has sunk to 42% despite the win rate remaining unchanged, and closing 4-point favorites are 3-5 SU and 2-6 ATS this season (FYI: Faves between -4 and -4.5 are 4-15 ATS in 2025-26).

Now, I‚Äôm not betting the Bears solely on them being 4-point underdogs.

Chicago‚Äôs explosive passing attack can expose this L.A. secondary, that‚Äôs struggled in the home stretch and just made Bryce Young look like Steve Young in the Wild Card Round (for the second time this season).

And there‚Äôs the matter of the Rams traveling for a second straight week and coming into a cold climate, with extended forecasts calling for bitter temperatures (some models show -7) and potentially 20-plus mph winds at Soldier Field.

If you like the Rams, you may want to avoid the point spread altogether and choose a moneyline ranging around -200. For the sake of this column, I'll grab Chicago +4 Sunday night.

My NFL Underdogs column is 32-22-2 ATS this season for ++6.56 units.

Odds are correct at the time of publishing and are subject to change.
